param.name: Convert Height to Geoid Height
param.desc: Convert WGS84 height to geoid height (mean sea level) height

param.desc: Number of GPS samples to compute time offser

param.desc: System command to execute everytime the clock is synchronized

param.desc: The highest address available for a device.Highest Address values must match for all communicating devices.

param.desc: Source level when medium is water

param.desc: Source level when medium is underwater

param.name: Address Section
param.desc: Name of the configuration section with modem addresses

param.name: Reception timeout
param.desc: Maximum amount of seconds to wait for missing fragments in incoming messages

param.default: Chlorophyll, Conductivity, CpuUsage, Current, Depth, Distance, EntityState, Fluorescein, FuelLevel, GpsFix, Heartbeat, LblConfig, LblRange, LblRangeAcceptance, Phycocyanin, Phycoerythrin, PowerChannelState, Pressure, RhodamineDye, RSSI, Rpm, Salinity, SoundSpeed, StorageUsage, Temperature, Voltage, PH, Redox

param.name: Active
param.desc: True to activate task, false otherwise

param.name: Serial Port - Device
param.desc: Serial port device used to communicate with the modem

param.name: Mailbox Check - Periodicity
param.desc: Amount of time without alert rings or MT SBDs before doing a mailbox check

param.name: Flush Interval
param.desc: Number of second to wait before forcing data to be written to disk

param.name: Transports
param.default: Abort, Announce, AcousticLink, AcousticOperation, CpuUsage, Current, Depth, DevDataText, EntityList, EntityState, GpsFix, Heartbeat, IridiumMsgRx, IridiumMsgTx, IridiumTxStatus, LblRange, LblRangeAcceptance, LogBookControl, LogBookEntry, PlanControl, PowerChannelControl, RemoteSensorInfo, RSSI, StorageUsage, Temperature, UamRxFrame, UamTxFrame, UamTxStatus, UamRxRange, UsblAnglesExtended, UsblPositionExtended, UsblFixExtended, UsblModem, UsblConfig, Voltage

param.name: Active
param.desc: True to activate task, false otherwise

param.name: Enable Reports
param.desc: Enable system state acoustic reporting. When enabled, systems shall acknowledge reception of requests to broadcast acoustic messages containing the overall state of the system. When disabled, those requests shall be ignored

param.name: USBL Node -- Enabled
param.desc: Enable system's USBL mode. When active, this system will start using USBL by actively broadcasting an acoustic message containing a request to get USBL feedback. The request contains the period for transmissions, if quick (two-way travel) or ranging (three-way travel) mode is desired, and, if in ranging mode (not "quick"), to use absolute or relative positioning. If a USBL modem is in reach, they will start exchanging acoustic transmissions to provide USBL positioning to the system. Any system can be configured to request USBL information including modems with built-in USBL capabilities

param.name: USBL Node -- Period
param.desc: USBL's period. This value determines the period of USBL positioning data. If "Quick" mode is selected, modem shall ping the USBL modem with this period to get bearing and elevation (two-way travel transmission). If "Quick" mode is disabled, ranging information is included for a proper fix. In this case, the USBL modem pings the node, hears the reply, computes the position and transmits back to the node (three-way travel transmission)

param.name: USBL Node -- Absolute Fix
param.desc: If this argument is enabled, USBL sends an absolute fix using WGS-84 lat/lon coordinates. If disabled, then the positioning is relative to the origin of a system where the center of the reference frame is the USBL modem

param.name: USBL Node -- Quick, No Range
param.desc: In this mode, the USBL node does not request ranging information. Thus, with this mode enabled, there's only a two-way travel transmission between the node and the USBL modem. The node will actively ping the modem to get bearing/elevation information With this mode enabled "Absolute Fix" argument is ignored

param.name: USBL Modem -- Announce Service
param.desc: This argument only concerns systems with USBL modems installed. This parameter statically adds a USBL announce, even if service has not been detected yet (eg. modem not connected)

param.name: USBL Modem -- Max Waiting Time
param.desc: This argument only concerns systems with USBL modems installed. This value establishes the maximum amount of time that the modem waits for the target system's reply

param.name: Local Port
param.desc: Local UDP port to listen on

param.name: Static Destinations
param.desc: List of <IPv4>:<Port> destinations that will always receive outgoing messages

param.name: Filtered Entities
param.desc: List of <Message>:<Entity>+<Entity> that define the source entities allowed to pass message of a specific message type.

param.name: Announce Service
param.desc: Announce this transport to services or not

param.name: Underwater Communications
param.desc: Allow underwater communication when limited comms are being simulated

param.name: Transports
param.default: Abort, AcousticOperation, AcousticSystemsQuery, AcousticSystems, CpuUsage, Current, Depth, Distance, EntityList, EntityParameters, EntityState, EstimatedState, FuelLevel, GpsFix, Heartbeat, IridiumMsgRx, IridiumMsgTx, IridiumTxStatus, LblRange, LblRangeAcceptance, LogBookControl, LoggingControl, NavigationUncertainty, PlanControl, PlanControlState, RemoteSensorInfo, RSSI, StorageUsage, Temperature, UsblAnglesExtended, UsblPositionExtended, UsblFixExtended, UsblModem, UsblConfig, Voltage

param.name: Always Transmitted Messages
param.desc: List of messages that will always be transmitted disregarding communication limitations

param.name: Local Messages Only
param.desc: Only transmit messsages from local system.

param.name: Command - On Power Down
param.desc: Command to execute before powering down

param.name: Command - On Power Down Abort
param.desc: Command to execute when powering down sequence is aborted
